case_title: Messrs Rehmani Dawakhana, Main Bazar Gandam Mandi, Kasur vs Commissioner Inland Revenue, RTO, Lahore
appellant: Messrs Rehmani Dawakhana, Main Bazar Gandam Mandi, Kasur

accussed_details.name: Messrs Rehmani Dawakhana
allegation: Failure to register for sales tax despite turnover exceeding threshold
Non-payment of sales tax on supplies

complaint_summary: The taxpayer failed to register for sales tax despite declaring a turnover of Rs.94,200,316/- for the tax period July 2019 to June 2021, making them liable for sales tax registration and payment.
investigation_summary: A show-cause notice was issued on 19.12.2022 alleging non-compliance with sales tax registration and payment obligations. The taxpayer was compulsorily registered but failed to comply, leading to an assessment order under section 11(2) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990, creating a demand of Rs.16,014,054/-.
judgment_summary: The tribunal found that the assessment order was passed beyond the scope of the show-cause notice, rendering it illegal. The proceedings initiated and finalized under section 11(2) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990, were declared null and void. The appeal was allowed, and the impugned order was annulled.
legal_arguments: The assessment order was passed beyond the scope of the show-cause notice.
No demand could be created without confronting the taxpayer in the show-cause notice.
The CIR(A) remanded the case despite identifying illegality, which was argued to be against section 45B(3) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.
key_issues: Validity of assessment order beyond show-cause notice
Non-confrontation of allegations in show-cause notice

legal_terms.Show-Cause Notice: A legal notice requiring a party to explain or justify their actions.

words_and_phrases.Nullity in Law: A legal act or decision that is void and has no legal effect.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the legality of an assessment order under section 11(2) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990. The tribunal annulled the order, citing procedural defects in the show-cause notice and subsequent actions.

key_issues_details.legal_defects: Order passed beyond show-cause notice, defective notice invalidating proceedings
